marytts.language.it.preprocess

Class ExpansionPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.language.it.preprocess.ExpansionPattern
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeEP, NumberEP, SpecialCharEP

    public abstract class ExpansionPattern
extends Object
    For preprocessing, serve as a base class for the different types of possible expansion patterns. For simplicity's sake, it is implemented in a "greedy" way: As soon as an expansion pattern matches, it is applied, i.e. the matched tokens are expanded according to the expansion rules in the pattern.
    Author:
    Marc Schröder

      • knownTypes

        public abstract List knownTypes()
        Returns the types known by this ExpansionPattern. These are possible values of the type attribute to the say-as element, as defined in MaryXML.dtd. Each subclass needs to override this to return something meaningful.
        Returns:
        known types

      • reMatchingChars

        public abstract Pattern reMatchingChars()
        Returns the regular expression object matching any of the chars occurring in the pattern. Each subclass needs to override this to return something meaningful.
        Returns:
        reMatchingChars

      • process

        public boolean process(Element t,
              List expanded)
        Try to match this pattern starting at token t. If successful, replace the matched tokens with the replaced form.
        Parameters:
        t - the element to expand. After processing, this Element will still exist and be a valid Element, but possibly with a different content, and possibly enclosed by an <mtu> element. In addition, <t> may have new right-hand neighbors.
        expanded - an empty list into which the expanded Elements are placed if an expansion occurred. The list will remain empty if no expansion was performed. Elements placed in the list are not guaranteed to be only t elements, but may be elements enclosing the expanded t elements, such as mtu elements, as well as non-t empty elements (such as boundary elements). If the list is non-empty, it is guaranteed to contain (either directly or as descendants of the list items) at least one t element.
        Returns:
        true if this pattern is confident to have fully expanded this list of tokens, false if nothing could be done or more expansion may be necessary.

      • isCandidate

        protected boolean isCandidate(Element t)

      • match

        public void match(Element sayas,
         String typeString)
           throws DOMException
        Try to match and expand the entirety of tokens enclosed by the say-as tag sayas. The type of data to expand is given. If the tokens can be matched according to type, they are expanded. Throws DOMException if sayas's tag name is not "say-as".
        Parameters:
        sayas - sayas
        typeString - typeString
        Throws:
        DOMException - DOMException

      • canDealWith

        protected abstract int canDealWith(String input,
              int typeCode)
        Decide whether we can expand a string according to type typeCode. This is important in cases where a particular expansion is requested via a say-as element. As a default, reply that a string can be expanded if it would be matched by the pattern recognizer. Subclasses may wish to override this with less strict requirements. Returns the type as which it can be expanded, or -1 if expansion is not possible.
        Parameters:
        input - input
        typeCode - typeCode
        Returns:
        true if it can deal with input and typeCode

      • match

        protected abstract int match(String input,
        int typeCode)
        Subclasses do their matching in this class.
        Parameters:
        input - is the String to be matched,
        typeCode - is the index in knownTypes to match with.
        Returns:
        type actually matched on successful match with this type (if typeCode is a general type ( typeCode == 0), it may have matched with a more specific subtype). On failure, -1 is returned.

      • expand

        protected abstract List expand(List tokens,
          String text,
          int typeCode)
        Subclasses do their expansion in this class.
        Parameters:
        tokens - is a list of token Elements to be replaced with their expanded form. The expanded forms are inserted into the DOM tree at the same positions as the tokens in List tokens. If there are more new tokens than old tokens, the rest are inserted as siblings at the position of the last old token.
        text - is the String to be expanded,
        typeCode - is the index in knownTypes this string has matched with before.
        Returns:
        the list of expanded (=new) tokens.

      • makeNewTokens

        protected List makeNewTokens(Document doc,
                 String newText)
        The default way to create new token DOM elements from whitespace-separated tokens in a string. String tokens have the form
        graph or graph[phon], where the optional phon, if present, is set as value to the sampa attribute of the t element.

        All expansion patterns that do not require any special attribute settings should create their new tokens using this method.

        Returns a list of token elements created from Document doc, but not yet attached in the tree.

        Parameters:
        doc - doc
        newText - newText
        Returns:
        makeNewTokens(doc, newText, false, null)
